intro: Bossiaea laidlawiana, commonly known as the Laidlaw's bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to the south-western region of Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in heathland and open forest habitats, often on sandy or gravelly soils. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and usually have a rough texture, while its fruit is a small, dry capsule. Bossiaea laidlawiana is an important component of the local flora and is of interest to botanists and conservationists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological role.
